definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: The near-synonym discrimination plays an important role in English learning.
sentences.chinese: 近義詞辨別在英語學習中是不可忽視的重點和難點。

sentences.english: Also make sure to learn synonyms or antonyms.
sentences.chinese: 當然對於它的近義詞與反義詞我們也要掌握。

sentences.english: Don't mix up this pair of synonyms.
sentences.chinese: 別把這兩個近義詞混淆了。

sentences.english: Patriotism is closely associated with nationalism, and the terms are often used synonymously .
sentences.chinese: 這個詞與“民族主義”是近義詞，常常緊密聯繫。

sentences.english: Porto is nearly synonymous to port wine, and also its rich history.
sentences.chinese: 波爾圖和波特酒幾乎是近義詞，也同樣有豐富的歷史。

sentences.english: Error of synonym using is a quite outstanding kind among the error of word using.
sentences.chinese: 在詞語偏誤中，近義詞的使用偏誤是較爲突出的一類。

sentences.english: Kuan Chang and Kuan Kuo are two synonyms.
sentences.chinese: 寬敞和寬闊是一對近義詞。

definition: lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to whisper to one another's ear
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
